reviews.text: The best espresso martini in the city, and the Peking duck is a must-have.

The atmosphere and ambiance is amazing. The food is top notch but the SERVICE can go for some DRASTIC improvement. The service John El.. or Johnny (not sure which his actual name is) made pretty great drinks but he wasnt very attentive and after i didnt finish my food he insisted upon packing it to go (i normally always pack my own food to go) but he explained thatbit was company policy. I get home and he literally shaved my whole plate into a box and I wouldnt even feed this to my dog. Im dissapointed cause the food was very good and I even told a few friends to come back but his service is HORRIBLE and deeply disappointed. Not to mention his AUTOMATIC GRATUITY was almost $100 which isnt a probpem but he didnt deserve $50â€¦ i will not be coming back to this establishment solely based off him.

One of my friends found this spot on TikTok and we were so excited to check it out but it definitely fell short of our expectations. The food is overpriced for no reason, the drinks need some work, and the coconut dessert tasted like it had been sitting in the fridge uncovered. Gratuity is included so be prepared for slow service. The best part of this place was the ambiance. Honestly Iâ€™d rather go to a hole in the wall Asian spot than spend 300 plus on basic food.
Everything about The Monkey King was fantastic. Atmosphere was chill, food was exceptional, and the staff are the best of the best. Friendly, engaging, fun and very attentive. Fabulous experience.

ALL THE FOOD WAS A 10/10
And I am a vegetarian but I do eat seafood and they had big options shareable the shrimp toast is my favorite

My niece Lexy took us to this restaurant to celebrate her dadâ€™s birthday. the atmosphere was very nice and cozy The food was superb. I would rate this restaurant a10/10 the crab fried rice, shrimp toast the general tsp shrimp, cucumber salad , everything on the menu was delicious. Our waiter Jonathan was great!! Would definitely recommend this place.

The food was generally good, but prices felt more like the West Village than Bushwick. Portions of wine were tiny for nearly $20 a glass, and they added auto-gratuity for a table of three, which felt insulting. Service was okay but pushy on upsells, and drinks came out awkwardly spacedâ€”one at a time over several minutes. Inside is nicely done, but the loud rap music makes it feel more like a club than a restaurant. Overall, decent experience â€” maybe worth getting takeout from instead.

We came here to celebrate my friendâ€™s birthday and it turned out to be such a lovely experience. The food was flavorful and beautifully presented-every dish had that perfect Asian-fusion balance of comfort and creativity.

The ambiance is where this place really shines. The lighting is warm and moody, giving it that intimate, modern-lounge feel without being too dark. The brick accent wall, emerald-green booths, and gold fixtures make the space feel cozy yet upscale-perfect for date nights or small gatherings.

Our waiter Jonathan was excellent, attentive, kind, and made us feel welcome from the moment we sat down. Service really can make or break a dining experience, and he nailed it.

My only wish is that the cocktail list was a bit more extensive, because the drink I had was okay, and I wouldâ€™ve loved to explore more options. The wine list was impressive Iâ€™ll admit, but I wasnâ€™t in the mood for wine lol

Overall, it was a beautiful night-great food, beautiful setting, and wonderful company. Iâ€™ll definitely be back!

Service here is amazing! Thank you Manasi! Very friendly and attentive. Ambiance is beautiful.

We tried many dishes from the menu and almost everything was truly a 10/10; very flavorful. We got Char Siu, Tea Smoked BBQ Ribs, Crispy Garlic Fried Chicken, and Roasted Duck-Fat Fried Rice. The Crabcake Shumai was a disappointment, 5/10. Drinks were okay, tasty and not strong.

For all these dishes and two drinks, party of two, the bill came out to $190.

Itâ€™s really unfortunate that the host treated us poorly when we entered bc it honestly put us in a bad mood the whole time. If youâ€™re reservation only why seat us? If thereâ€™s a table open for us (for literally 90 minutes) then why tell us youâ€™re res only? It just comes off as rude and unnecessary especially coming from someone in sweatpants. Benefit of the doubt, maybe mgmt tells them to say it in which case mgmt do better. Our server was great and the food was really good and we probably would have stayed longer and tried more on the menu had we not been put off by the entry. For reference la cantine down the street was fully reserved and perfectly polite about it and we thanked them and left. It isnâ€™t hard.

The waiter was really amazing and the ambiance was nice.

Terrible lighting at this restaurant and I have 20/20 vision. The taste of the food was not worth the price on the menu. We got the Black Pepper Steak (4/5), Crispy Garlic Fried Chicken (2/5) and Roasted Duck-Fat Fried Rice (2/5)

The black pepper steak was pretty flavorful, the Crispy Garlic Fried chicken had a crispy outer layer (like the name says) but flavor ?? Im not too sure what happened with that and the Roasted Duck-Fat Fried Rice taste like regular fried rice (so Iâ€™m confused by the name)

Wouldnâ€™t go back again but I do recommend Brooklyn Chop House and Philippe Chow â€¦

This was one of the best dining experiences Iâ€™ve had this year . The food was immaculate , the staff was so attentive and gave great suggestion and the atmosphere was ideal .  I canâ€™t wait to go back and have that Peking duck again ðŸ’•

Monkey King is a real gem. Ambiance is perfect, dim lighting yet warm and inviting. The staff was friendly and attentive, and the food impressed from start to finish. The crab and pork soup dumplings are a must before they sell out. The lamb ribs, crispy garlic fried chicken and beef chow fun were delicious, all dishes were bursting with flavor. Iâ€™ll definitely be back around to try more of the menu.

NOT HALAL! i brought my bengali mother here for her birthday and she was so offended by the pork rings on the menu and the cocktails :( shouldâ€™ve checked the menu beforehand. iâ€™m sad i wasted my money and trusted the owners of the restaurant

So HAPPY to have this restaurant in our neighborhood!!! The CRABCAKE SHUMAI is so yummy!!!! CHAR SIU Divine!!! FRIED SHRIMP TOAST!!!!!! PEKING DUCK is the BEST EVER!!!! DOUBLE GARLIC EGGPLANT I'm dying SO DELICIOUS!!!!! BAO BUNS!!!!!
This is the best restaurant!!! We love you!!!!!
Great service, great staff..
Could be considered a bit on the pricey side but the food is good - quite flavorful

Been here about 5-7 times. I've noticed hostess and all the rules getting worse each time. First it was the forced 20% gratuity. Which I can understand and didn't bother me too much. But the rules about the bar are kind of weird. And makes it awkward for the hostess. Anyways. I walked in tonight, Saturday and just asked to sit at the bar, was told now it's "reservation only" then I mentioned I didn't know and hostess was just pretty rude to be frank. It's upsetting. Eventually when a place gets too many rules it starts to feel inaccessible, and that's what's happening here. I have stood up for this place on TikTok, etc so it just sucks to not be greeted too kind. Almost like how dare me walk in on a Saturday to ask for a seat lol. Anyways I left. May not be back again unfortunately.  Leaving 3 stars bc I love the food and moreso sharing for feedback to management as I've seen this place change since opening
Great drinks and the ambience was super fun. The food was amazing too
The owner came up to us and was super nice! Service was great food and atmosphere was modern, a unique take on Chinese food in NYC!

Extremely disappointing experience. I arrived 10 minutes late to my best friendâ€™s birthday dinner, where the restaurant had already seated a table of 9 with a fixed menu. I completely understood that we couldnâ€™t be added to the check, so I asked if my husband and I could sit at the empty table right next to the group and order separately.

The waitress was extremely rude and dismissive, saying it was â€œagainst policyâ€ with no effort to explain or offer alternatives, despite the restaurant being almost completely empty and it raining outside. The only option she gave was to sit at the bar, facing our friendsâ€™ table, which made no sense and felt unnecessarily inflexible.

In the end, we had no choice but to leave. The whole interaction made us feel unwelcome and created an awkward, avoidable situation for us and the rest of the party. I understand the policy around the fixed menu, and yes, I was late, but I traveled a long way in bad weather to be there. A little empathy and basic respect wouldâ€™ve gone a long way. Really disappointed with both the service and the attitude.

DON'T GO TO THIS PLACE, STAY AWAY!!! I just had one of the worst receptions of my life at this restaurant.
I arrived at the place and couldn't join my best friend's dinner table because there were already eight people at the table. The only option they gave us was to sit at the bar with our backs to the birthday boy's table,
and the restaurant was completely empty!

My first visit, the ribs and crab fried rice were very delicious yet the garlic chicken was dry.

My second visit, the ribs (still) and fried mushrooms were good but the crab fried rice was dry, the sauce for the rice was odd, and the eggplant was ok.

They charged us for some items without notice such as $1 for the sauce for the rice and $2 to add ketel one to a dirty martini. Also note, the music was really loud so it was hard to talk.

While I wouldn't go back, I'm glad I experienced it twice. No issues with the service ðŸ’¯
Service was great, our waitress and the host were welcoming. But food was very average and lacked taste. The prices donâ€™t justify the food or ambiance. The malagarita drink was quite good

Let's keep this review short, sweet, and to the point.  Hannah was the highlight of the night. Charismatic, fun, helpful, and personal.  10/10 for Hannah. She deserves the 20% automatic gratuity added to your bill.  The ambiance was cozy and nice, with no complaints there. As for the food, we could've gone to the Chinese buffet, and the food would've tasted better.  The food lacked seasoning. The only things that tasted good were the dipping sauces.  Also the entrees don't come with sides so it's more al a carte style. Spent $378.00 for a party of 4. We could've gone to Brooklyn Crab House instead.

There is absolutely no monkey-ing around at Monkey King. From the moment you grasp the handle of the entry door, there is no way you wonâ€™t leave transformed. While being greeted by the oh so kind hostess, you are given a moment to truly embrace the aura of the space. Your eyes first gravitates to the immersive semi sunken bar surrounded by blissful golden barstools illuminated by soft light. As the hostess carefully walks you to your seat, you begin to feel the opulence of the decor melting away the stress of your day.
The journey truly begins once you scan the restaurant menu. There you will find an array of beautifully thought out cocktails, wines, and dishes that truly awakens oneâ€™s curiosity.
To begin our journey, my cousin and I thoroughly enjoyed the Char Siu and Scallion Pancakes to wet our palettes. Hannah, our server, patiently guided us through the cocktail options making superb recommendations. Our first round of cocktails included the Serpentâ€™s Tale and the Immortal Peach. We then drooled over the Cumin Lamb Ribs and Roasted Duck- Fat Fried Rice. All dishes bringing us to euphoria. To close out, we ordered another round of cocktails that included the Heartbeet and Pandan Express. The cocktails were so incredible that I literally got out my seat and walked to our bartender, Thieanna, to give her applause.
Which, by the way she accepted with such humility. The craftsmanship of those cocktails surely deserves a spot on the 50 Best Bars in the World. And as someone who has been to five bars on the list within the last four months, the compliment comes with ease because they definitely belong on that list.
I want to express my gratitude to Thieanna, Hannah, Thom, De Cory, and Nana for such a superb dining experience. Little did they know that the warm service along with the outstanding meal helped me to kick the depression that was knocking at my door that day. So thanks Monkey King for a memorable journey. I will definitely see you again soon!

Alexa was great. The design of the bar is inviting. The serpent tail- don't be a wuss you have to try it - is delicious.

Seating arrangement wise would flow smoother if the tables were round.
If eating in a group style enure to order 2 of each when it comes to the appetizers. You'll receive 3-5 pieces, depending on the selection, to share from each order

I visited The Monkey King on Friday night with the misses and our 2 year old daughter. The host was extremely accommodating and made us feel welcomed even though the environment was curated more for an adult dining experience. The dishes were designed for family style groups so bring your family and friends for sure. Letâ€™s start with the cocktails where my wife enjoyed The Monkey King and I indulged in the Evening Harvest. Both were well crafted & balanced cocktails which left me speechless. Iâ€™m a mixologist and I was pleasantly surprised by the intentionality and craftsmanship of both these masterpieces. We ordered 2-3 small plates and each one was better than the next. For entrees we ordered the Cumin Lamb Ribs, Duck Fat Fried Rice and the String Beansâ€¦ Superb!!! This is a DEFINITE must try restaurant. You wonâ€™t be disappointed for damn sure.

I am really disappointed in this place, I feel like it has really gone downhill since it opened. The portion sizes have for sure decreased for many of the items and the price does not reflect those changes. I have come multiple times and the experience with the host is always strange, there are tons of reservation spots open but always refuse to seat you until your entire party is there (even though itâ€™s rarely busy) and then also wonâ€™t seat you at a table without a resâ€¦which again would be fine if they were at all busy. I also donâ€™t mind a digital menu but this one is hard to navigate and also was missing the cocktail menu and nobody brought us that menu. A lot of the food is tasty but I donâ€™t think itâ€™s worth it to go anymore.
Very laid back  food ate All

From the drinks to the entrees, everything was delicious. We had some great cocktails, which I canâ€™t remember the names of. The General Tsos Shrimp was perfectly cooked and the sauce was so good. The scallion pancakes were fluffy yet slightly crispy. Was too stuffed for dessert, but definitely gotta leave room for that next time.

Found this gem on TikTok, and it did not disappoint. The ambiance was perfect - dim lighting and cozy vibes made it a great date night spot.

I ordered the Monkey King drink, which was delicious and came in the cutest panda-shaped cup. Everything we ordered was so good. Our waitress was a gem, service was quick, and we had zero complaints.

Highly recommend starting with the scallion pancakes and char siu pork. For mains, we ordered the the black pepper steak, wok fried string beans, crab fried rice, and General Tsos shrimp. Everything was amazing!

I went for my birthday tonight with my 2 daughters. Spent exactly $400 including tip. Definitely not worth the money. Paid cash because upon receiving the bill was made aware there would be an additional 3% for credit card which should be disclosed beforehand. The char sui pork was tender but lacked the traditional BBQ flavor. The Ginger, scallion lobster was cooked perfectly but lacked any ginger flavor at all. The crab fried rice was flavorless and the rice seemed like it was scraped from the bottom of the pot. It was dry and hard. The sautÃ©ed bok choy was also flavorless and soggy. The shrimp dumplings were good. The scallops were okay but the one I had tasted of iodine. The portions were surprisingly small. The cocktails were lackluster served in the smallest glasses I've ever seen. The attire of the servers was unacceptable for the pricepoint of the menu. It looked like they had just come from the laundromat straight to work.We went there for an experience and left underwhelmed. For $400, for a party of 3, there is a lot that needs to improve.

Our family took an hour and half trip to this restaurant since it was promoted as a Bengali Chinese fusion place. We made reservation in advance to ensure our spot. Upon arrival we were seated in our table within minutes. The place appeared modern and slick, cool dining tables and a dining bar that is little below the restaurant floor. But I found the restaurantâ€™s ambiance too dark, it was hard to see anything around the restaurant. The iPhone taking all the pictures in night mode, thatâ€™s how dark it was.

The menu was via QR code but the restaurant had no reception for Verizon. I asked them for wifi and they gave me one that had network problems. So I had to walk outside multiple times to load the menu. Once I read thru the menu I was disappointed to see it was full of regular Chinese appetizers and entrees, nothing Bengali about any of them.

We ordered whole bunch of items, starting with the soup dumplings. The soup dumplings barely had any soup, I counter, about five drops came of each dumpling. Shrimp shau mai and pearl dumplings both were basic. The vegetable dishes like pickled cucumbers, eggplant with garlic sauce and boiled bok choy were actually far better good dishes. Chicken wings were also good. The best dish of the night was the lamb ribs. They were soft, juicy, tender, had amazing taste. But it took them an hour to bring the dish out. We finished all our other food, and then waited 10-15 minutes more to finally see the lamb dish arrive at our table.

The service was pretty good. Our server was very polite and friendly. The staff cordially greeted me for fatherâ€™s day. Although the dinner was fine, I felt like for the price we paid the dishes could have been far better quality and quantity. I had eaten most of these dishes in other Chinese restaurants for half the price.

I visited Monkey King last week Tuesday around 8pm. It wasn't super busy, so we were able to be seated immediately. I didnt care for the fact that they don't serve any of the steamed dumplings during the week, only on the weekends. The Pan Fried Chicken Dumplings,were ok. The whole filling on the inside kept falling out with every bite. The Fried Shrimp Toast was definitely an acquired taste, its not for me. The Char Sui and Marinated Sichuan Cucumbers were soooooo good! 10/10 definitely recommend. The Beef Chow Fun was also good. The staff was polite and attentive. Each plate is sharable. You can with 2-3 people and be full off of what we ordered. The total bill was $200, which is kinda expensive considering 4 of the 5 items ordered were appetizers. Oveall I will visit again for my favorites and to try their dumplings.

Planned to eat here 2 hours before a show we had tickets to. Miscalculated time so had to call and adjust reservations, they were happy to accommodate. Late trains put us there 35m before show timeâ€¦no way I thought. Let the hostess know, would have been totally reasonable to just cancel us. They got us seated and fed in remarkable fashion and with remarkable care and out the door to our show in perfect time. Absolutely blown away by their care and attention. Not to mention the food we scarfed down was absolutely amazing. I really hope I can go back someday to enjoy it more. Thank you again to all of the staff. You guys are what make a restaurant exceptional! Iâ€™m so thankful that you took the time to care!

2 stars for the food.
5 stars for service.

Family saw a reel online and decided to try this place. They will only sit you when your whole party arrive. The staff are very nice and friendly. Attentive through out the service.

Once you enter, you see the bar area in a lower ground which is cool. After-hour vibes, dimmed light, comfortable seats.

The food is mediocre. They advertise as Chinese-Bengali fusion but thereâ€™s no Bengali food expect for one dessert. Very basic for all the dishes. Small portion even though they say itâ€™s â€œsharingâ€ style. Nothing comes with rice. The only dish I like itâ€™s chicken wings, tender and wrapped with flavors.

Also I can smell weed from our table. Nothing against people who smoke but I really hate that smell.

The food here is delicious, that's a fact. And the service provided was great. But the reason I'm going for 3 stars is because of the fact that Auto-gratuity was added into a table of 2. In the industry is a well known practice for tables of 6+ people or events. But never for a 2 pax one. On top of that the server didn't mention it, so if you don't check closely you'll ended up over tipping, which isnt the problem. Is the the whole action what matters to me. This plus the $50 fee for reservation cancellation is definitely a turn off. Is Bushwick, not Manhattan. And on the atmosphere side, honestly I don't want to be listening to Hip-Hop/Rap while I'm having dinner. Honest review, I'll keep recommending the food since it's amazing no doubt, but that's my take. Cheers!!

The owner is a rude woman. She spoke to my party in a nasty manor (during a birthday) that is unacceptable on all levels. I do not recommend this location. This is definitely not the place to get cute and enjoy a girls night out for a birthday!
Cozy restaurant in Brooklyn. Great ambiance. Very welcoming. Amazing service. Food was amazing we ordered almost everything on the menu. Staff were amazing. We will be back soon.

Went here for an anniversary dinner. Overall the staff were friendly and accommodating and we really enjoyed the food. My partner, from China, said that the food reminded him of home! Worth checking out!

Dined at TMK a few weeks ago before going to see a show in the neighborhood. It was one of the best meals Iâ€™ve had in a long time! And the service was fantastic. Highly recommend getting the Pork Soup Dumplings, Chicken Pan Fried Dumplings, Shrimp Toast, Char Sui, and Scallion Pancakes to start. And the Fried Chicken, Duck Fat Fried Rice, String Beans and Lobster for mains. Incredible experience. Thanks TMK!
Best Asian fusion food experience. This shrimp toast is like no other!
Absolutely delicious

We ordered the following items:
1.	Chicken Dumplings (Appetizer)
2.	Chili Oil Cucumber Salad (Appetizer)
3.	Garlic Fried Chicken (Main)
4.	Duck Fat Fried Rice (Main)
5.	Lamb Ribs (Main)

The cucumber salad arrived first. Unfortunately, it was underwhelming â€” we found it lacking in both salt and chili oil flavor, making it feel quite flat. We requested chili oil twice, but it wasnâ€™t brought over until we asked a third time, which impacted the flow of the meal.

The chicken dumplings were the highlight of our dinner â€” well-prepared and flavorful. We truly enjoyed them.

The garlic fried chicken came out surprisingly early, before the fried rice or lamb ribs, even though we were told the mains would be served together. As a result, the chicken sat and got cold while we waited. We had to ask twice about the rice before it was finally brought out, followed by the lamb â€” but by that time, the chicken was no longer hot.

The duck fat fried rice was fresh and hot, but lacked basic seasoning â€” a bit more salt wouldâ€™ve made a noticeable difference. As for the lamb ribs, they were overwhelmingly fatty with very little actual meat, which made them disappointing.

We think the restaurant has potential, but unfortunately this experience missed the mark in both flavor and service flow.

I canâ€™t say enough about the food!  Well seasoned, great portions and a nice playlist to set the vibe! I loved the cumin ribs and the sauce for the scallion pancakes was phenomenal! And our server, Hannah did a fantastic job explaining the options and has a great personality!
The best restaurant I've ever been to!

Ordered takeout, got fewer pieces of everything. They give 3 BBQ ribs instead of 4 advertised. The same goes for shrimp toasts and crab cakes, fewer pieces. The food wasnâ€™t bad, but this sort of shrinkflation is very upsetting.
Flavorful food and chill customer service. 10/10 would recommend

I came here for dinner on a weekday and had an alright time. As soon as you walk in, you're greeted with an open space with some seating, a sleek bar, and then the restaurant seating in the back. Service here was overall pretty quick and nice. The biggest thing that I wanted to note though was that they are pretty strict on their 90 minute dining limit, which I wasn't a fan of. As we went on a weekday where there were visibly many open seats, and to be constantly told or reminded of the dining limit felt abrasive and made us feel rushed. If we were given the option to move to the bar or something (ie. if they needed the table for another reservation), then it may have made sense.

If we were to solely talk about the food then I would say that it was great. We got the cucumber salad, the peking duck, and the beef chow fun. Everything was delicious and I would have been able to finish each of those by myself (maybe not at the same time though haha). Portions were good, and I would definitely recommend each of these dishes. Overall, although the food was good, I just think that the experience itself was really subpar (to be rushed) and for that reason alone, I don't think I would return (ie. you can find great dishes like these with a better dining experience).

A few of my favourite influencers have ranted and raved about The Monkey King, and noted it as one of their favourite places for Asian fusion in Brooklyn. So, I went with really high hopes and an empty stomach.

Overall I would say that it was dinner surrounded by trendy diners. Definitely not somewhere I would recommend if you were looking for a quiet, intimate dinner. But if you are looking to celebrate, this will definitely be a great spot - there were a few birthday tables, that definitely were on turn-up mode.

The food was pretty good. We liked the Char Siu and Soup Dumplings ðŸ¥Ÿ.

With the service, our server seemed to be quite preoccupied with other tables. We had to ask to have more water a few times, and my partner and I found the cocktails to be super small and packed with ice.

We love the food here and I've been going since it opened. The owners are so friendly and the staff is so accommodating. The food whether it's delivery or dine in is impeccable. These photos are from the Lunar New Year menu, but highly recommend exploring their specials on any given day. The shrimp toast is something we never fail to get - out of this world.

Please check this place out if you're in the neighborhood! It's beautiful and the food is worth it.

That duck fat fried rice is EVERYTHINGâ€¦the place it self is great, the decor is subtle but cuteâ€¦ I had the cumin lamb and that was delicious. My friend had the same duck fat fried rice with shrimp ( I forgot the name) e we had a great server/ hostessâ€¦. Overall Iâ€™d definitely recommend and would go back.

If I could give 6 stars I would. One of the best dining experiences I have had in a LONG time. The food was exceptional. Everything we ordered was a hit. We got scallion pancakes, spareribs, dumplings, fried garlic chicken, green beans, and duck fat fried rice and vanilla/strawberry shortcake.  Our service was top-tier, waitress was knowledgeable and friendly. Decor was so cute with 70s sunken living room vibes and on my opinion the menu was reasonably priced.

Bathrooms were super clean and parking was easy to find.

100000% will be back

The server told us the restaurant is to showcase the kids of the immigrants which I think is a good description of the restaurant. It added a bit western twist to the traditional food so if you are looking for authentic Chinese dishes this is not the best place to be. Overall I would say the food was fair, a few things I actually feel tasted better without the sauce (the sauce for the shrimp toast and the sauce for the fried garlic chicken not really enhanced the flavour to my taste). Another observation is the portion of the small plates were very generous, same as the portion for main dish if not bigger lol. A nice place overall.

The Monkey King is my number one favorite spot to indulge in, I visit here super often and every visit & bite is worth it! The atmosphere is stunning and the vibes are immaculate. I found that the left overs hits just as much (or maybe a little more). Gourmet comfort food & all around 1000/10

Itâ€™s only fitting that the most delightful and memorable dining experience Iâ€™ve had came at a restaurant named after my favorite childhood hero.

As a first generation immigrant from China who grew up on authentic Asian cuisine, Iâ€™ve always been wary of dining in â€œAsian fusionâ€ restaurants. Oftentimes in my experience â€œAsian fusionâ€ was synonym with unnecessarily experimental â€” Often sullying classical dishes with perplexingly additives and ingredients.

The Monkey King is evolutionary â€” paying homage to the traditional cuisine, Iâ€™ve grown to love while allowing room for the diverse palette found in NYC to serve as inspiration for change. There wasnâ€™t a dish that I felt was changed just for the sake of change.

I had the privilege of being seated in the kitchen for a private chefâ€™s tasting. Delicious food aside it was so novel to be dining behind closed doors. We were treated like VIPs and it felt truly exclusive. Iâ€™ve never experienced something like this before and I hope itâ€™s not the last.

The tasting consisted of 4 small plates and 6 entrees. Highlights for me are:
1. The Chicken Dumplings, which was seared to perfection. The cinnamon red oil not only gave this dish a unique flare but enhanced the flavor that made every bite leaving me wanting more.
2. The Shrimp Toast. I love the contrast from its crunchy outer shell to its juicy shrimp interior. It tasted familiar, yet I canâ€™t point to a dish quite like this one. Itâ€™s as if they took a combination of dim sum dishes and married it to create this masterpiece.
3. The Duck Fat Fried Rice. Itâ€™s delicious. I can truly say their fried rice has ruined all other fried rice for me. This is above and beyond any other friend rice variant for me.

Every dish that was brought to the table was superb. Words cannot do the dishes justice. Whether you are dining in or ordering takeout, I highly recommend you try them for yourself. I am confident you wonâ€™t be disappointed.

OVERALL: A++

I don't usually write reviews for restaurants but The Monkey King really compelled me to take my time and write this.

I'm not sure if it'll get lost among all the other reviews but if you're happening to read this, enjoy!

When I try a restaurant, I'm usually focused on 2 factors: the food (obviously) but also the experience.

Our experience at The Monkey King was, for lack of any other word, superb. The ambience with the decor & lighting set up a perfect vibe for either an intimate date night or a friendly outing with your group.

All servers were super attentive and I never had trouble flagging anyone down to refill our glasses because the entire staff was on top of it, including making sure our table was cleared through the ongoing course of our meal.

The food was beyond delicious, it was like throwing a concert of your favorite band (but for my taste buds).

We had the Cumin Lamb, Lobster Lo-mein, string beans, & chicken dumplings.

It's hard to rate them because they're all so good but hands down my favorite was the lamb. I have no idea how the chef made this, but clearly the hands of angels/god and our server was involved lol!! The lamb was crispy on the outside and juicy/soft inside and covered in a honey drizzle that really complemented the flavor that was cooked in.

I wish I could give a higher rating than 5 stars but Google doesn't have that feature yet.

Thank you Monkey King! Will be coming here a lot and telling everyone about it :)

What a treat!

Upon walking in I was greeted by Chase who had an amazing spirit and smile. I was also in awe of the sunken bar which was absolutely unexpected and gorgeous. The vibes were perfect and I love the simplicity of the decor (sleek and precise).

Btw I forget our waiters name but i must say he was a vibe and took very good care of us.

They indeed have a full bar but the drink menu is very miniature and unexciting if I'm being honest.

Now to the food

A few must haves and I mean MUST HAVE
-Shrimp toast was absolutely wonderful. Crispy on the outside and melts in your mouth. PERFECTION.
-Wok fried green beans were to die for and then they added rib meat...it was unexpectedly mind blowing.
-Char Sui I wanted to lick the plate. The pickled veggies and ginger scallion sauce were the perfect accompaniment.

A few Disappointments
-Shelter Prawns weren't necessarily terrible but also could have been an e-mail. Dry, no flavor simply boring.
-Orange Cardamon cake almost seemed as an after thought. It too was dry, maybe serve with a whipped cream, ice cream or all together throw away.

All together I really enjoyed mostly everything. I thoroughly enjoyed meeting  one of the owners and her telling us a little about the inspiration behind the concept etc. I'll be back to try more things for sure.

Honestly one of the best restaurants in Bushwick. Everything we tried here was amazing. The service was great, they made sure we were taken care of and gave us good recommendations.

Below is our review for individual dishes:

> The Amazing - big fan of the XO Crab friend rice, Fried Sichuan Oyster Mushrooms is really good with the dips, Fried shrimp toast is just ðŸ¤ŒðŸ¼

> The good - Double garlic eggplant was really flavorful.

Let me preface this by saying my review reflects my own tastes as an American-born Chinese (ABC) with an ABC palate.

I visited "The Monkey King" last night after seeing its high Google Reviews. While the food was decent and the atmosphere pleaant, I cannot recommend it for the price. If you're looking for similar or better food at a lower cost, I'd suggest taking the subway to Chinatown instead.

Service & Ambiance
When we sat down, we were immediately asked if we wanted still or sparkling water, which felt like an unnecessary upsell. Tap water was available, but it wasnâ€™t offered upfront.
The tables were set with only forks and knives, which suggested that ABCs and other Asians aren't the restaurant's target diners (though, to be fair, I do have one cousin who doesn't know how to use chopsticks). We were asked if we wanted chopsticks and the ones provided were reversible -- an interesting but impractical design. Reversible chopsticks make it unclear which side has been used, making them more confusing than functional.
We dined around 9:30 PM. Service was noticeably slow, though the restaurant was busy. At the start, a staff member took our coats, but when we left, no one was at the reception, so I had to find and grab my own coat.

The Food
We ordered:
- Char Siu
- Soup Dumplings (pork & crab) (but only pork was available)
-Beef Chow Fun
- Roasted Duck-Fat Fried Rice
- Crispy Garlic Fried Chicken

The Soup Dumplings came with small bowls instead of the usual Asian soup spoons, making them awkward to eat. We werenâ€™t given an explanation for the bowls, and their ergonomics didnâ€™t make sense. It seemed like an attempt to be stylish at the cost of practicalityâ€”form over function in a way that hurt the dining experience.

The Char Siu had good texture and flavor, but the addition of ginger-scallion felt offâ€”itâ€™s traditionally paired with Soy Sauce Chicken or Roast Duck, not Char Siu. This felt like a misinterpretation of Cantonese BBQ, as if someone unfamiliar with the cuisine saw ginger-scallion paired with roasted meats and assumed it belonged here. That said, as ABCs, my guest and I love ginger-scallion, so we still enjoyed it.

The Beef Chow Fun was okay. The ribeye used was a nice upgrade from the cheaper cuts in traditional versions, but I didnâ€™t love the contrast between the soft noodles and the firmer steak texture. A more tender cut, such as tenderlion/filet mignon, might have worked better.

The Crispy Garlic Fried Chicken was the biggest disappointment. The chicken was overcooked and dry, and the large cuts made it difficult to eat. Traditional Cantonese fried chicken is usually chopped into smaller, manageable pieces, but this dish seemed to prioritize a Western-style presentation over ease of eating. Itâ€™s frustrating when restaurants sacrifice user experience just to make a dish look more refined.

Verdict
While The Monkey King offers a stylish setting and some creative takes on Chinese dishes, too many choices seemed driven by aesthetics rather than functionality. From the impractical soup dumpling bowls to the oversized, dry chicken pieces, the experience felt like it was designed to look good rather than to be enjoyable to eat. For the price, Iâ€™d recommend heading to Chinatown for better food with more thought put into the dining experience.

Came here for a friendâ€™s birthday and had a great time!!! The bell pepper steak and chicken dumplings were by far my favorite dishes. Also, Hannah was an AMAZING waitress and literally made our experience 20x better!

This place has a pretty well put-together menu for Chinese fusion food.

Our favorites were the tea smoked ribs and the string bean dish but the crabcake shumai was disappointing. We didn't know this when we got the food but we realized later on that they actually gave us one less shumai in the dishðŸ’€. I also have to agree with the review above about the turmeric sauce not really complementing some of the dishes. I actually thought it paired pretty well with the shrimp toast but not so much with the shumai.

The atmosphere was so-so. Not so much of an elevated vibe compared to the food, as the place has loud music and almost a clubby atmosphere.
We absolutely loved our server though! Would consider returning.

I've been to Win Son, Wen Wen, and Birds of a Feather--and griped about trekking to each and every one of them because I felt the food was mediocre, under-portioned and overpriced. Chinese food for white hipsters, blech!

The Monkey King, which is even farther for me than the other places, was worth the trek. Harvey Wong and Munzzy Uddin have found the magic formula for balancing all the elements that you need to make a modern Asian restaurant work: authentic flavors, creative dishes, inviting decor, and friendly service. Throw in a stellar cocktail menu that surpasses many of the artisanal speakeasy spots in Manhattan, and they're on their way to something great.

- Char Siu: As authentic as the bare bones Hong Kong BBQ spots I grew up with, right down to the ginger-scallion dipping sauce that makes me want to cry tears of glory (and I hate scallions).

- Fried Shrimp Toast: Okay, I might actually have teared up eating this. Do you know how hard it is to find shrimp toast? You almost never see it on Chinese/Asian menus, and when it's there, it usually sucks. Not so here. Get this. Drench yourself in the sauce. Thank me later.

- Cumin Lamb Ribs: RIP Fu Run and their amazing giant rack of cumin ribs. This is no Fu Run, but it's a nice take. I could've used a tad more cumin and no mesquite honey drizzle, but the fall-off-the-bone quality of the lamb was top-notch.

- Seasonal Market Greens (bok choy): Because we all need to eat vegetables. Huge portion--I did not regret this.

- Roasted Duck-Fat Fried Rice: Fragrant and light. Those expecting a flavor bomb of duck don't understand what duck-fat fried rice means. There should be a hint of duck, that's it--this is a supporting dish, not the main player.

- Orange Cardamom Olive Oil Cake: They source their desserts from a nearby bakery, so if that matters to you, maybe skip this. I liked it, but that's because I love orange and cardamom and olive oil cake.

Harvey told us he's gunning for the World's 50 Best Bars, and I have to say that the cocktails here are much more impressive than some of the NYC spots that have actually made the list (ahem, Katana Kitten, ahem Dead Rabbit). For fresh, earthy flavor, try the Heartbeet. For complex beyond your wildest dreams (and the only use of gunpowder green tea I've ever seen!), try The Atelier if it's available. For lip-numbing zest, try the Malagarita--though if I were Harvey, I'd put a ton more Szechuan peppercorns.

And to think, the food now is just their takeout menu!

Amazing! Between the food, the service and the ambiance, I had an amazing time. We made reservation for two and were seated right after we checked in. Shawn, our waiter for the night, was very personable and light hearted.

Cocktails
Deepfake Lassi: I ordered this twice, should tell you everything
Atelier is quite smokey; my boyfriend, an avid whiskey drinker, loved it
House Spritz: refreshing and light

Now the food
The shrimp toast : I would eat this every day honestly. So crisp on the outside but soft in the inside. The shrimp is not overpowering. The coconut curry dipping sauce was the perfect pairing

Scallion pancake: I'm normally quite picky w textures but these were honestly addictive. They were not soggy and oily. Another well balanced dish

Double garlic eggplant: great veggie option

Beef chow fun: you can never go wrong with noodles and these were a great choice. Seasoned well. The noodles had a great texture and beef was well cooked and not chewy

The star of the show were us were the cumin lamb ribs. You just have to go order them for yourself to see how good they are. There were glazed with a hot honey (if I remember well)

I've already sent the recommendation to a lot of my friends. One of which has gone and give this spot a 10/10

For an asian focused spot in bushwick with the best vibes, this is that spot. The monkey king vibes are great, with decor making you feel like you on a date, or meeting up with friends.

The food was amazing, with my favorite double garlic eggplant and fried sichuan oyster mushrooms both having tons of flavor that goes well with the duck fat fried rice. Seasoned veggies, and string beans were also a hit as well as the tri-color dumplings which I will admit were a bit pricey but worth it to get once. The black pepper steak was also great with tons of flavor.

Drinks are under $20 and pretty good, worth a try, but the food is definitely the star of the show as it should be.

The dessert was okay, mango lassi cake didnâ€™t really taste mango at all. It does rotate monthly, so hopefully get something better next time.

Bathroom was clean and staff were friendly.

Ideal coming either way between 3-6 ppl works best for you to try what youâ€™d like, since there is a requirement to do a tasting menu for larger parties so be warned.

Also the QR code menu just leads to the website landing page and not the dine in menu, which could be improved and reduce confusion going forward.

The excessively loud environment greatly detracted from what could have been an enjoyable dining experience. I would recommend this restaurant to those who donâ€™t mind dining in a bustling and noisy atmosphere, but for those seeking a more tranquil setting to enjoy their meal and conversation, this may not be the ideal choice.

The staff were attentive and courteous, ensuring that our orders were promptly taken and our needs attended to throughout the meal. Overall, while the service and food quality were satisfactory, the overwhelmingly loud ambiance overshadowed the positives of our dining experience.

The monkey king surely has become one of my favorite spots in Brooklyn. Everything starting from the service to the food and the aesthetics were on point. We started with the mouthwatering chicken which is served room temperature and tasted amazing, along with that we ordered the chicken dumpling, that taste really good! For me the must tryâ€™s are the cumin Lamb ribs, the crispy garlic fried chicken and the garlic eggplant with some jasmine rice is just heaven. The food tastes really good its got a good fusion with Chinese and Bengali flavors to it! The manager was kind enough to serve us string beans with beef rib eye that was on the house! We were fortunate enough to experience â€œGambeyâ€ which basically means you take a  shot and put the glass upside down and make sure nothing drips from your shot glass when you do it. Overall an amazing experience, thanks to management and the owners for giving us an amazing experience! The bar will be live in December so I will definitely return to try their cocktails! I will recommend this place to everyone that loves and appreciates different food and culture.

The attention to detail is the first thing thatâ€™s gonna draw you in on this once industrial section of bushwick.

Itâ€™s the perfect addition to the neighborhood.

Once you walk-in you are greeted with aroma of delicious food, followed by some of the best hospitality you can ask for.

The staff of super responsive and attentive.

This is a great place to enjoy a meal and share it family styles they donâ€™t skimp on the portion nor the flavors.

The chicken dumplings were great, the scallion pancakes were also delicious (they are usually oily, these were light and crisp). For mains I would highly recommend getting the garlic chicken with a side of broccoli and white rice.

All the flavors compliment one another.

The interior design is beautiful. The staff is wonderful, the attention to details is great, the prices are very reasonable, the bathroom is super clean (the Le Labo soap is ðŸ”¥), and the owners are very caring!

Cannot wait for them to get their liquor license.

Would highly recommend coming here! Iâ€™m sure Iâ€™ll be back soon!

10 out of 5 Stars. I need to start by saying this is by far one of the best restaurants I have been too in a long time. The owners are completely amazing people and take pride in the work they are doing. The food is just truly amazing the Char Sui was sooooo amazing!!!! We Questioned the pan fried dumpling because of the sauce but when we actually got to try it we wanted more and more and more! I had the duck fat fried rice which was absolutely amazing. I just wish it had a little more duck in it but the flavors were on point! My boyfriend had the shrimp fried rice with pineapple being that I am allergic to pineapple I did not try it but my boyfriend was amazed by the flavors and wished I could have experienced it with him. The Garlic Fried Chicken was Some of the best chicken I have had in my life. You can tell it was brined for a few days and seasoned well. This is the definition of a successful restaurant in the making. Keep this up and they will be able to become a Michelin star for their amazing flavors and service. This is my new favorite restaurant in Brooklyn!!!!!!

If you are reading this review, please go dine at Monkey King promptly.

Excellent food.
Portions are generous
Drink pairings are solid.
Tableware is high quality (and produced in Brooklyn!)
Service is professional.
The price is a great value when you consider cost of operating in Brooklyn, NY and the portions.

Dinner for 2 could consist of 1 or 2 apps, a rice, vegetable side, and 1 main dish (easily shareable). With drinks and 25% tip (the service was that good), $200.

Strongly recommend the Shrimp Toast, Soup Dumplings, and Duck-Fat Fried Rice.

I expect this establishment will be going after 1-star status in the coming year.

I had the opportunity to try the chef's tasting at the Monkey King and it was one of the most authentic, lively, delicious experiences I have had!

The environment was clean, tidy and covid friendly. The music and ambiance had a delightful flow from starting off mellow during appetizers and picking up by the time we were ready for dessert.  10/10

The Food 10/10 ðŸ¤¤ ðŸ¤¤
My favorite cocktail was the Jambura Masala
Chicken dumplings - one of the best i have tried so far!
Scallion pancakes - had a nice crunch to it and reminded me of a paratha, it was so good!

The lamb ribs, string beans and crispy garlic chicken are all must haves!

Fun fact about the crispy garlic chicken from the owner: "Each order goes through a 48 hours prep and cook process incorporating Asian techniques which results in an ultra crispy skin that will max out the crunch meter!"

And the crunch was perfect ðŸ‘ŒðŸ½

Will definitely be coming back and planning to host future events at this restaurant!

So glad I got to give this place a try! I showed up around 6pm on a Saturday with no reservations  but luckily someone cancelled right as the host was telling me there were no more tables lol. Please learn from my mistakes and grab a resy if you're heading here for dinner!

Once seated I was greeted by my fabulous server Ava who shared that The Monkey King serves Asian-fusion food that is designed to be shared. She recommended ordering about 2-3 small plates and then a main dish to share. At the recommendation of the bartender I ended up ordering the sichuan mushrooms, the char siu pork, the beef chow fun, and then one of the specials- The Peking duck. The mushrooms and char siu pork ended up coming out first and both were great. The mushrooms were lightly battered and fried and had a lovely kick to them. The pork was well seasoned and cooked and came with some beautifully pickled veggies on the side. Next came the beef chow fun which was the highlight of the meal for me. The noodle dish was FULL of flavor and it took everything in me to keep eating it despite how full I was honestly starting to get ha. Lastly we were able to try the Peking duck which came with a side of cucumbers, green onions, orange hoisin sauce, and bao buns to make mini duck baos. Another huge hit which makes a lot of sense as The Monkey King is known for their duck! Overall a really high quality choice. A great place to go with family, friends, or a date :)

Probably some of the best modern Chinese food and Asian inspired cocktails in town. You can feel the love and passion the staff put into creating something truly unique. Must try are the garlic chicken, crab fried rice, string beans, hargao and of course there amazing baijiu cocktails in the cute panda mugs. If you love taste and texture these are for you ðŸ¥°

Monkey King was sooo good! New fave Asian spot in Bushwick.

My friends and I have been dying to eat here together (literally for over half a year) and came for Lunar New Year (perfect time to go!!!) Theyâ€™re so thoughtful with the overall vibe of the restaurantâ€”from the lights to furniture to glassware to plates and even the bathrooms (love me an establishment that offers Le Labo). Staff members and owners were all really nice, knowledgeable, and accommodating. I love how they described the concept of the restaurant and made us feel welcome. The sauces on every plate were incredibly flavorfulâ€”especially the cinnamon red oil-infused soy sauce!!! We honestly wanted to take them home in a to-go container. The Pan Fried Chicken Dumplings were juicy and memorable. The Crispy Garlic Fried Chicken was so tender, and I usually donâ€™t like Cantonese style chickenâ€”but they made it with a twist. Also loved the pea shoots. They packed a punch without being too salty and soggy. The off-menu items were fire too! I would def go again and try everything else on their menu. Canâ€™t wait to see them flourish and gain all the buzz they deserve. ðŸ¥²

First time back since they fully opened to the public and Iâ€™m so happy to see they are doing well and still providing amazing foods and service. I had the best dining experience Iâ€™ve had in a VERY long time (domestic and international) and I dine out and travel like every month.

We had reservations at 6:30pm on Friday night. We were greeted and seated immediately. I like the fact that they offer to check your coats. The ambiance is very chic and modern. The sunken bar is my favorite. They have nice comfy velvet chairs which they vacuum after each seatings. The lighting is just right and the music was a vibe. It was good mix of everything modern.

Service: Ava C was our server and she was great! She was very attentive and personable. She was very thorough explaining menu items, the current specials, and made some great recommendations. Both owners Munzy and Harvey stopped by our table to checkin and chat us up. This is honestly one of the things I love the most about TMK- they are very hands-on and is right there with their staff working and making sure everything is going well.

Drinks: we had rounds of the malagarita (fun twist of a spicy margarita) and house spritz. Both were really good and strong! We also had the Hild Elbling Sekt Brut #52 and COS Rami 2021 from the wines complimentary of the owner Munzy.

Food: talk about an explosion of culture fusion! I wanted to explore all new items I didnâ€™t have the first time but didnâ€™t wanna cheat my friend out of her experience so we went all in! We had the pan fried chicken dumplings, tea smoked BBQ ribs, fried shrimp toast, char siu, roasted duck fat fried rice from the regular menu and the crabcake shumai, XO scallops, and ginger scallion lobster lo mein from the specials. I kid you not when I say we did not have a single bad dish! Everything was amazing!! The flavors, the tenderness, the sauces- pure perfection! The only issue we had was finishing all the food we ordered lol.

TMK is top tier! You get fine dining experience with personalized service, great food AND portions! Canâ€™t wait to return to tackle the other menu items!

I saw this place on instagram and added it to my bucket list. My husband and I traveled from Atlanta just to try The Monkey King. The atmosphere is comfortable and laid back. Our waiter was accommodating and made us feel like we were seating in VIP. We met the owner Mike. He was professional and was grateful for us traveling to  Brooklyn New York  to try his restaurant. The taste from each dish blew us away from the concocted herbs and spices. We will definitely return.

We drove up from Philly for a birthday dinner! The hubby made reservations for my 41st birthday, and it was worth the drive. Everything was great BUT the duck fat fried rice took the prize! It smelled great and tasted even better. This wasâ€¦

A good friend of mine told me he had made reservations at The Monkey King and I agreed to show up because I'm rarely a no-show when it comes to food. I went in completely blind so I was not expecting to be seated in the kitchen and to be given an immense amount of attention and care from everyone at The Monkey King.

The food honestly speaks for itself. I can go on forever about it. The cha-siu, and I'm not kidding, tastes just as good if not better than the long-standing Cantonese BBQ joints in Chinatown. The flavors are further elevated by the ginger-scallion sauce they provide on the side and they somehow managed this without it tasting pretentious, if that makes sense.

The shrimp was beautifully breaded. It looked so crispy that I thought they fried it with the shell on, but of course they had the shrimp de-shelled, because why wouldn't they? The shrimp toast with curry dip was their Asian-influenced take on grilled cheese and tomato soup -- a great snack. The duck-fat fried rice was the perfect complement to the rest of the dishes. It added a whole new layer of decadence. The veggies were stir-fried and seasoned to perfection, you'd honestly have to taste them to believe it.

With all of that said though, my three favorite dishes were the chicken dumplings (these little guys exploded with flavor and juices), the cumin spare ribs with Mike's Hot Honey, and the Mouthwatering Chicken dish. I wish they were a bit closer to my residence, I would easily place delivery orders every other day.

All of the drinks prepared by Harvey hit the spot but the last one (served with the slice of orange shown in the photos) was on a different level. It's like an old fashioned, but with a bit of smokiness? For those who have had herbal tea (or wong lo kat in cantonese), it's like that, but with less sugar and alcoholic. I'm not sure if it'll make it onto the menu permanently (I sure hope so), but if it does, I'm ordering one with every meal at The Monkey King moving forward.

It was honestly a great time. Thanks TMK, Munzy and Harvey, and the team there that night!

PS They found out it was my dad's birthday that night and ended up letting me go with two additional dishes on top of the ones I originally ordered to-go.
